title: Calories in Biscuits
meta_description: Discover calories in biscuits, including macros like carbs, protein, and fat per serving, plus tweaks and FAQs for better nutrition tracking.
assumptions: Plain American-style buttermilk biscuits, baked, medium size (~60 g each), no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, and preparation method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium biscuit has about 212 kcal, with 26 g carbs and 4 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 pat of butter per biscuit
Whole wheat flour version (lower cal due to less fat)

faqs.q: How many calories in one biscuit?
faqs.a: About 212 kcal for a medium plain biscuit.
Yes, one biscuit has ~26 g carbs, mostly from flour.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in biscuits?
faqs.a: Around 10 g total fat per biscuit, with 3 g saturated.
Only about 4 g per biscuit; pair with protein sources for balance.

faqs.q: How does biscuit size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger biscuits (~80 g) can have 250+ kcal; smaller ones less.
